Package fr.utt.lo02.xfmv.jest.controller

Class Partie

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.utt.lo02.xfmv.jest.controller.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Partie
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Core gameGUI engine. Runs in a separate thread and waits for messages in its queue. Handles a lot of objects and collections necessary to play a Jest gameGUI : players instances, base and temporary card stacks used in a gameGUI turn, trophies, reference on current playing player, booleans to know which phase to play... Each method in this class is explained separately. Singleton (so the constructor is private and you access it by a getter method), since only one is needed and we need to access its attributes and methods A LOT and from quite a lot of objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Partie getInstance()

      • initGame

        public void initGame()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Method used to initialize a gameGUI of Jest. The idea here is to create every card needed for the gameGUI using Colors and Values enums, then creating real players and/or bots according to what the user wanted in the gameGUI config CLI/GUI. It finally shuffles the card and directly ends by calling playGame() method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • distributeCards

        public void distributeCards()
        Method used to hand out cards to players instances at the beginning of the gameGUI and between each turn. Also used in first turn to put one or two cards in the trophies collection. Draws and hands out cards from the base cards stack for the first turn. For other turns, it takes back all the players' remaining cards, put them in a temporary stack, adds cards from the base cards stack and finally hands all those out to the players for the next round.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Central method of the class. Loops through distributeCards(), hidingControl() and jestingControl() until the base cards stack is empty. After that, the method put the last card in the hand of each player in their respective Jests. Instantiate a Jest-counting object, then each player accepts the counter (based on a Visitor design pattern) to calculate scores. Ends by calling the method finishGame().
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • hidingControl

        public void hidingControl()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Method that handles the "hiding" phase of the gameGUI. Cycles through the players to ask which card they want to hide. If it asks a real player, then it waits for a response (so a "1" or "2" message from the gameGUI's message queue : refer to the project's controllers to get the full grasp of how the "message" system works). If it asks a bot, it chooses randomly between 1 and 2. Once a card is selected, it becomes hidden, update the GUI and loop to the next player, until everyone has played.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • jestingControl

        public void jestingControl()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Method that handles the "jesting" phase of the gameGUI. Cycles through the players to ask which card they want to put in their Jest. According to the official rules of the gameGUI, the player with the best visible card after the "hiding" phase is the first to play, so we sort the players collection (refer to Player class compareTo()). Two temporary collections are created : one with references to the pickable cards and one with references of the player(s) it is from (we should have done this with a Map but couldn't find the time to). Same way that for every user input in this project : the method waits for a message ("1", "2" or eventually "3" and "4" depending on the situation here) to be put in the message queue from GUI or CLI. Stops when everyone has played.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • handOutTrophies

        public void handOutTrophies()
        Method to hand out trophies to players who should get them. Kind of a barbaric function, since every trophy has different conditions to be redeemable. So it tests out different things depending on the trophy. The trophy card then go into the player's Jest.

      • finishGame

        public void finishGame()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Method to "close" the gameGUI at the end. Cycles through the players' scores to see who is the winner, and create a reference to it for the CLI and GUI to display it ! Puts every variable necessary to start and play a gameGUI to default.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • run

        public void run()
        Inherited from the Runnable interface. Just call the method initGame(). We need this so that this Game singleton runs in a separate thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
